head.title: National Briefing | Rockies: Colorado: Sex Offense Ruling Is Upheld

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Rockies: Colorado: Sex Offense Ruling Is Upheld

block.p: The State Supreme Court upheld a ruling that would free many sex offenders from parole and state prisons. The state attorney general, Ken Salazar, had asked for a rehearing last month after the court ruled on conflicting legislation concerning the parole of sex offenders. The latest ruling will free 70 sex offenders from prison on Wednesday and hundreds more from parole soon. Sex offenders must still register with the state.
